result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both 5th offense and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of 5th offense and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen was found guilty of 5th offense, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1,800.00 plus all costs, penalties and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Deendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving three (3)  months of Initial Confinement in this case and 18 months of Initial Confinement in Walworth County case 14CF323.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

On State's motion, Court ordered COUNTS 2 and 3 DISMISSED.  As to the amended charge in Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
  
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  


Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $1,800.00  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges by out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 2 years.
Court ordered ignition interlock for 1 year, consecutive to revocation.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 36 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 0 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 months of initial confinement in this case and 18 months of initial confinement in Walworth County Case 14CF323.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge in Count 1 amended to Operating While Intoxicated ~ 5th Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.63(1)(a), 939.50(3)(h), a Class H felony and the charge in Count 2 amended to Operating with Prohibited Alcohol Concentration ~ 5th Offense, contrary to Wis. Stats. 346.63(1)(b), 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.

Attorney Frederick F. Klimetz in court, defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record.  Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Frederick F. Klimetz in court, defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is newly appointed and does not have discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 11-28-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen in court with attorney John Matthew Krejci.  Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance Roeschen in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Krejci informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
